titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Bright but very cold. I attended service at 8 a.m., & received the Holy Communion. After breakfast I worked at my Easter day sermon: & then wrote a few lines to Mary, consoling her with the reflection that the safest time for traversing the narrow seas was immediately after some successful coup by the German submarines.
& I attended the funeral service of
in Bow Church. There was a very large gathering of men. Afterwards I attended Evensong, & then resumed work on the sermon.
